APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION TO THE BAR AND

PURSUANT TO ARTICLE 94 OF THE CIVIL PRACTICE
LAW AND RULES
DIRECTIONS
(Read all these directions carefully before
attempting to answer any question.)
1. This is a statement made under oath. Applicant's failure fully and accurately
to disclose any fact or information called for by any question may result in
the denial of the application for admission, or if applicant shall have been
admitted before the discovery thereof, in the revocation of his license to
practice law. 2. Answers must be in
black ink, preferably in typewriting, but may be in applicant's handwriting or
hand printing. 3. Unless otherwise
indicated, every question and every part of each question must be answered, even though the answer be negative. 4. Where "Yes" or "No" suffices, employ that
form in answer. 5. If the applicant
cannot comply with any of the requirements, he must state in detail the efforts
he has made to comply and why he cannot. Answers on information and belief will
be accepted only in connection with matters which the applicant cannot be
expected to remember because of extreme youth or other equally sufficient
reason. All statements made on information and belief must be so designated in
the sworn statement, and the sources of information must be given. 6. Should the space left for any answer be
insufficient, the applicant shall complete his answer on a rider page, attached
to page 11 hereof, specifying the number of the question to which it relates. More than one rider may occupy a rider page. Each rider page should be signed. Avoid riders whenever possible. 7. In stating addresses give street and number, if any, city village, county and
state or foreign country. 8. In
giving a period which is continuing at the date of verification of this sworn
statement, always give such period as continuing "to date."

STATE OF NEW YORK APPELLATE DIVISIONS OF THE
SUPREME COURT COMMITTEES ON CHARACTER AND FITNESS
INSTRUCTIONS TO APPLICANTS FOR LICENSE AS
LEGAL CONSULTANTS
GENERAL INSTRUCTIONS
(Applicable to All Judicial

Departments)

Strict compliance with these instructions is
required. Incomplete, defective or carelessly prepared papers will occasion
delay and may result in the rejection of the application. Any false statement contained in the
applicant's papers, or any failure to disclose any material fact, may result in
the denial of the license application; or if the applicant shall have been
licensed before the discovery thereof, in the revocation of the applicant's
license. Applicants should read carefully the Rules of
the Court of Appeals For the Licensing of Legal Consultants (22 NYCRR Part
521
)
and the Rules of the Appellate Division relating
thereto. 1. OFFICIAL FORMS -- Applicants will be furnished the following standard forms: Questionnaire, Affidavits of Character, Affidavits as to Legal Practice, and

College and Law School Certificates. 2. QUESTIONNAIRE -- Every applicant shall
complete and file a verified questionnaire, preferably typewritten, and must
answer all questions fully, truthfully and accurately. If the space provided be
insufficient for a complete answer, the answer may be given on a rider which
should be signed by the applicant, specifying by its number the question to
which it relates. Avoid use of riders, if possible. 3. AFFIDAVITS OF CHARACTER -- The applicant
shall submit affidavits as to the applicant's good moral character and fitness
from three reputable persons residing in this State and not related to the
applicant, one of whom shall be a practicing New York attorney. 4. COLLEGE AND LAW SCHOOL CERTIFICATES -- A
certificate shall be submitted from each college and law school attended by the
applicant. The forms provided for that purpose should be sent by the applicant
to each such institution, together with a stamped envelope addressed to the
appropriate filing office (indicated below) of the Appellate Division of the

Department in which the applicant resides. 5. CERTIFICATE AS TO APPLICANT'S ADMISSION TO
PRACTICE AND GOOD STANDING -- The applicant shall submit a certificate from the
authority having final jurisdiction over professional discipline in the foreign
country in which the applicant was admitted to practice, certifying (a) as to
the authority's jurisdiction in such matters, (b) as to the applicant's
admission to practice in such foreign country and the date thereof and as to
his good standing as an attorney or counselor at law or the equivalent therein, and (c) as to whether any charge or complaint has ever been filed against the
applicant with such authority, and, if so, the substance of each such charge or
complaint and the disposition thereof. Such certificate shall be signed by a
responsible official or one of the members of the executive body of such
authority and shall be attested under the hand and seal, if any, of the clerk
of such authority. 6. LETER OF
RECOMMENDATION -- The applicant shall submit a letter of recommendation from
one of the members of the executive body of such authority or from one of the
judges of the highest law court or court of general original jurisdiction of
such foreign country, certifying to the applicant's professional
qualifications. Such letter of recommendation shall be accompanied by a
certificate under the hand and seal, if any, of the clerk of such authority or
of such court, as the case may be, attesting to the office held by the person
signing the letter and the genuineness of his signature. 7. AFFIDAVITS AS TO LEGAL PRACTICE -- The
applicant shall submit two affidavits by attorneys or counselors at law or the
equivalent admitted in and practicing in such foreign country, stating the
nature and extent of their acquaintance with the applicant and their personal
knowledge as to the nature, character and extent of the applicant's practice, and as to the applicant's good standing, as an attorney or counselor at law or
the equivalent in such foreign country, and the duration and continuity of such
practice. 8. ADDITIONAL EVIDENCE --
The applicant may submit such additional evidence as the applicant may see fit
with respect to his educational and professional qualifications and his good
moral character and fitness. 9. ENGLISH TRANSLATION -- Every paper submitted pursuant to these instructions
which is not in English shall be accompanied by a duly authenticated English
translation thereof. 10. EXCEPTIONAL SITUATIONS -- In the event that the applicant is unable to comply
strictly with any of the foregoing requirements, the applicant shall set forth
the reasons for such inability in an affidavit, together with a statement
showing in detail the efforts made to fulfill such requirements. 11. UNDERTAKING -- The applicant's attention
is directed to the following rule of the Appellate Division: "Prior to taking custody of any money, securities (other than unindorsed securities in registered form), negotiable
instruments, bullion, precious stones or other valuables, in the course of his
practice as a legal consultant, for or on behalf of any client domiciled or
residing in the United States, every person licensed to practice as a legal
consultant shall obtain, and shall maintain in effect for the duration of such
custody, an undertaking issued by a duly authorized surety company, and
approved by a Justice of this court, to assure the faithful and fair discharge
of his duties and obligations arising from such custody. The undertaking shall
be in an amount not less than the amount of any such money, or the fair market
value of any such property other than money, of which the legal consultant
shall have custody, except that this court may in any case in its discretion
for good cause direct that such undertaking shall be in a greater or lesser
amount. The undertaking or a duplicate original thereof shall be promptly filed
by the legal consultant with the clerk of this court."
12. APPLICATION PAPERS -- Only fully
completed applications will be accepted for filing. Applications should be
arranged in the following order: Questionnaire verified by applicant. Certificate of admission and good standing in
the foreign country. Letter of recommendation. Affidavits of character. Affidavits as to legal practice. College and law school certificates. Any other papers applicant is required or
desires to submit. 13. FILING OFFICES -- Applications should be filed with, and all inquiries
concerning licensing procedures directed to, the appropriate filing office
(indicated below) of the Appellate Division of the Judicial Department in which
the applicant resides. Filing Offices

must be submitted to the appropriate filing office of the Appellate Division, noted above, personally or by mail. SUPREME COURT OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK
